news.title: Over 70 realty projects didn’t get registration certificates within deadline: RTI reply
news.para: Odisha Real Estate Regulatory Authority (ORERA) is facing criticism for significant delays in issuing project registration certificates, exceeding the mandated 30-day limit. This is causing financial strain for developers and potential buyers. While ORERA cites incomplete documentation, developers point to internal system weaknesses. New directives aim to expedite the process, but concerns remain about stakeholder representation.

news.title: Amaravati: CRDA plans single layout for returnable plots in LPS second phase
news.para: The Capital Region Development Authority is planning a unified layout for returnable plots in the second phase of land pooling. This move aims to consolidate government-acquired lands for major projects like an international airport and sports complex. Officials believe a single layout will expedite development and infrastructure provision, benefiting farmers and facilitating large-scale allocations.

news.title: NGT issues notices over illegal construction in Rohini green belt
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has issued notices to Delhi pollution control authorities and the DDA regarding illegal construction in Rohini's Sector 16 green belt. The tribunal ordered respondents to take preventive and punitive action within one month, ensuring compliance with the 2021 Master Plan and the Environment Protection Act.

news.title: Lodha Developers net debt up ₹800 crore in Q3 FY26 to ₹6,170 crore due to land purchases
news.para: Lodha Developers saw its net debt climb 15 percent to Rs 6,170 crore. This increase stems from aggressive land acquisitions across Mumbai Metropolitan Region, Delhi-NCR, and Bengaluru. The company is developing new housing projects with a total revenue potential of Rs 33,800 crore.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh CM orders strict action against irregularities in land lease allocations
news.para: Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has ordered strict action against irregularities in land lease allocations, emphasizing that no allotment made for monetary gain will be tolerated. During a Janata Darshan, he also directed officials to investigate allegations of land lease discrepancies for the poor and ensure swift justice for citizens.

news.title: NGT seeks responses on ‘illegal construction, environmental violations’ in Haridwar housing project
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has ordered the Uttarakhand Pollution Control Board and Haridwar-Roorkee Development Authority to submit responses. This follows allegations of illegal construction and environmental breaches at the Mantra Happy Homes Group housing project. A resident filed a petition claiming the project's sanctioned plan was revised. The tribunal will hear the case on April 7.

news.title: Telangana to issue TDRs for acquiring land parcels near water bodies
news.para: To boost the use of transferable development rights (TDRs), Hyderabad's municipal administration now mandates that high-rise buildings exceeding 10 floors must incorporate 10% of their built-up area using TDRs.

news.title: JK Cement's profit falls 8.5% to ₹173.6 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: JK Cement has reported an 8.56% dip in profit margins, recording Rs 173.61 crore for the December quarter. Revenue from operations soared by 18.18%, amounting to Rs 3,463.07 crore, driven largely by a significant 23% uptick in grey cement volume sales.

news.title: Delhi civic body records highest-ever property tax collection, crosses ₹2,700 crore
news.para: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi has achieved its highest property tax collection ever, exceeding Rs 2,700 crore for the 2025-26 financial year. This represents a significant 45 percent increase compared to the previous year.

news.title: Bhubaneswar: BDA progresses in town planning scheme no. 8 covering Andharua, Daspur
news.para: The Bhubaneswar Development Authority (BDA) has initiated Town Planning Scheme (TPS) no. 8, covering 560.81 acres to facilitate systematic urban development and an inner ring road without compulsory land acquisition. This move aims to integrate infrastructure and ensure equitable land distribution, with similar schemes planned for other cities.

news.title: Signature Global to invest ₹380 crore to deploy earthquake-resistant technology
news.para: Signature Global will invest ₹380 crore in advanced earthquake resistance technology for its projects over 15 years. This technology, Hysteretic Tuned Mass Dampers, will be used in buildings over 150 meters tall.

news.title: Jangaon: 15 held in ₹4 crore Dharani-Bhu Bharati land registration scam
news.para: Jangaon police have arrested 15 individuals in a Rs 3.90 crore scam involving fraudulent land registrations on Dharani and Bhu Bharati portals. The gang allegedly manipulated challan amounts and submitted forged receipts, causing significant revenue loss to the state. Investigations are ongoing to apprehend the remaining nine accused.

news.title: M-sand producers warn of protest and seek action against illegal sand mining in Belagavi
news.para: M-Sand producers in Belagavi are threatening to protest against illegal sand and M-sand extraction and transportation. They allege that unlicensed units are causing significant revenue losses to the government and legitimate businesses. Despite submitting memorandums, authorities have reportedly taken no effective action, prompting the association to warn of intensified agitation.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body launches asset monetisation drive to unlock revenue from its properties
news.para: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation's Asset Monetisation Cell is set to appoint a consultant to strategize the valuation and sale of its properties, including 4,113 leasehold assets estimated at over Rs 2,000 crore. The cell aims to boost non-conventional income by exploring options like developing reserved plots via PPP and renting school buildings.

news.title: NCLT approves Poonawalla Finance demerger splitting lending, real estate business
news.para: The National Company Law Tribunal has approved a major restructuring for Poonawalla Finance. This plan will split the company's lending and real estate businesses into separate entities. Poonawalla Finance will continue its lending operations. Its real estate assets will move to new companies, Rising Sun Holdings and Synergist Realtors. This move aims for sharper focus and better investor attraction.

news.title: Khata freeze leaves thousands of Bengaluru properties legally stranded
news.para: Years-long regulatory gaps at GBA have paralysed khata bifurcation and conversions, blocking sales, construction and loans, as officials promise internal fixes amid rising citizen frustration and financial stress

news.title: Gurugram: DTCP issues show-cause notice to Mayfield Garden RWA over alleged encroachment
news.para: Gurugram's DTCP has issued a show-cause notice to Mayfield Garden's RWA and a private entity for encroaching on 1.25 acres designated for a public dispensary in Sector 51. Unauthorized structures, including shops and hutments, were found on land reserved in the approved layout plan, violating urban development regulations.

news.title: Chandigarh: 4,500 properties mapped in sectors 2-17 under pilot survey
news.para: Chandigarh's NAKSHA pilot project is progressing well, with over 4,500 properties in Sectors 2-17 surveyed.  Despite tough weather, 20 teams are working towards a January 31, 2026 completion.  Deputy Commissioner Nishant Kumar Yadav praised the efforts, emphasizing accurate property records. Residents are urged to cooperate with survey teams for a smooth process.

news.title: Homestay benefits in Uttarakhand reserved for locals after misuse of scheme flagged
news.para: Uttarakhand's cabinet has decided to restrict homestay scheme benefits exclusively to state residents to promote local investment and revenue. This move aims to prevent non-residents from availing subsidies and ensure the scheme's original purpose of strengthening hill economies is met. The state will now focus on ensuring benefits reach deserving locals, fostering authentic cultural experiences for visitors.

news.title: Runwal Developers gets Sebi nod to float IPO
news.para: Runwal Developers plans to raise Rs 2,000 crore through its maiden public issue, comprising a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 1,700 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of Rs 300 crore by promoter Sandeep Subhash Runwal, as per the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP).
